title: Lesson 10
paragraph: This lesson covers politics and diplomacy, including negotiation, agreements, and international relations.

words.meaning: involving cooperation of two political parties
words.example: The bill received bipartisan support in the legislature.

words.meaning: a penalty or coercive measure; approval or permission
words.example: The UN imposed sanctions on the country.
The parliament ratified the new treaty.

words.meaning: to pacify or placate someone by acceding to their demands
words.example: The government attempted to appease protesters.

words.meaning: agreement or harmony between people or groups
words.example: The nations reached a concord after months of negotiation.

words.meaning: a friendly understanding or informal alliance
words.example: The countries maintained an entente to prevent conflict.

words.meaning: relating to a group within a larger group, often causing conflict
a person who opposes official policy, especially in authoritarian states
words.example: The dissident spoke out against the government.

words.meaning: a messenger or representative, especially in diplomacy
words.example: An envoy was sent to negotiate peace terms.
The nations signed a historic accord.
